definition: to fall into/to dip below a certain level
to fall/to tumble/to trip/(of prices etc) to drop/Taiwan pr. [die2]
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: Such had been his first dip into the dark abysses of existence.
sentences.chinese: 他第一次跌进人生黑暗深渊的情形就是这样。

sentences.english: He who digs a pit for others, falls in himself.
sentences.chinese: 想坑别人的人，跌进自己掘得陷阱里。

sentences.english: With a heavy noise, she fell into the pit.
sentences.chinese: 随着一声闷响，她跌进了坑里。

sentences.english: The fox fell into the trap and couldn't climb out of it.
sentences.chinese: 狐狸跌进陷阱自己爬不出来了。

sentences.english: Though you've slipped through death'sslim door.
sentences.chinese: 虽然你跌进了死亡的小门。

sentences.english: I am myself fallen unawares into the snares of death.
sentences.chinese: 我自己不知不觉跌进了死神的陷阱。

sentences.english: The pup was in a fix when he walked into the mudhole.
sentences.chinese: 小狗跌进泥坑便爬不出来了。

sentences.english: Falling into the blue bridge of hometown.
But then Clifford lost his balance! He tumbled into the tub of dye.
sentences.chinese: 但是克利福德身体一下子失去了平衡，跌进了染缸里。

sentences.english: At this moment, the slight bow-shaped moon fell into the valley opposite.
sentences.chinese: 这时候，那弯浅浅月跌进了河对面的山坳。

sentences.english: With hundreds of questions, my memory falled into the swirl of remembering.
sentences.chinese: 夹搭着一连串的疑问，我的思绪跌进了回忆的漩涡。

sentences.english: While playing by the river, one child slipped and fell in .
sentences.chinese: 一个孩子在河边嬉戏时滑了一跤跌进了河里。

sentences.english: How did we fall into such great invisibility within the Tao?
sentences.chinese: 我们是怎么跌进道内这场巨大的消隐无踪的？

sentences.english: I tripped and fell into a manhole
sentences.chinese: 我给绊了一下，跌进了一个窨井。

sentences.english: Then the little louse fell in and burnt herself.
sentences.chinese: 小虱子跌进蛋壳，烧伤了自己。

sentences.english: They fell into the seething waters of the rapids.
sentences.chinese: 他们跌进了翻腾的急流中。

definition: to lose one's footing/to slip/to take a wrong step in life
to tumble/to fall/fig. to suffer a reverse (in politics or business)
to stagger/to stumble/to reel/Taiwan pr. [lie4 ju1]
to fall headlong/(fig.) to suffer an ignominious failure
so deep one cannot see to the bottom/limitless
